Key Match Events: Shakib Al Hasan scored 64 runs, his first fifty in 20 T20I innings
Rishad Hossain took three wickets in four balls, changing the course of the game
Netherlands fell in a heap, losing 4 for 6 in the space of 16 balls
Post-Match Reflections: Bangladesh made a big stride towards securing a Super Eights berth at the T20 World Cup 2024
Thanks to this result, Sri Lanka are out of contention to qualify from Group D
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first international fixture in Kingstown in close to a decade
Others: Aryan Dutt made his debut for Netherlands in the tournament
Bangladesh's top order was studded with left-handers, Netherlands brought Aryan Dutt in for his first game
